titleStmt.title: The Buried Army
a hand-written transcription

availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.

note.p: Trial lines, possibly for "A Twilight Song," first published in 1890 and subtitled "For unknown buried soldiers, North and South."

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: The Buried Army
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839â€“1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.
As the document is written on the inside of an opened envelope, the verso contains Walt Whitman's mailing address, a two-cent stamp, and two inked stamps from the postal service.

lg.head: TheA Buried army
lg.l: As one of ‸severthese passing ages' countless armies halting

Under the mystic march, the
Officer over all
To other invisible campaigns bent and ready,
